pullRequest.title: Send dynamic filters from coordinator to workers

nodes.bodyText: In this implementation we send dynamic filters only along with scheduling of splits. Ideally we should send dynamic filters as they become ready. Current approach works reasonably well for hive as it generates splits in batches.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -509,7 +516,11 @@ private synchronized void sendUpdate()
                 fragment,
                 sources,
                 outputBuffers.get(),
-                totalPartitions);
+                totalPartitions,
+                dynamicFilters.entrySet().stream()

nodes.bodyText:
This should be Map<DynamicFilterId, Domain>
Will dynamic filters be sent with every TaskUpdateRequest?
Currently, we have a dedicated endpoint for fetching dynamic filters that keeps track of versioning. This way, we transfer only new (or updated) dynamic filters from workers to coordinator.
This scales better and allows us to send bigger DFs. Also we could potentially change protocol to be a binary one.
We might want to have similar approach when sending dynamic filters from coordinator to workers. Either we somehow refactor io.trino.server.remotetask.DynamicFiltersFetcher (e.g to work bi-directionally and keep track of worker version of coordinator DFs) or create another similar service.
The question is: does it make sense to send entire TaskUpdateRequest when DF is available or it's better to use another, dedicated communication channel?
In any case, I think initial DFs should be send in TaskUpdateRequest to reduce latency (if they are any)
Note that I don't think worker needs to specifically keep version of coordinator DFs, but it can be coordinator that logically tracks which domains were actually received by workers.
not needed as io.trino.server.HttpRemoteTaskFactory already has DynamicFilterService
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -35,5 +37,6 @@ RemoteTask createRemoteTask(
             OptionalInt totalPartitions,
             OutputBuffers outputBuffers,
             PartitionedSplitCountTracker partitionedSplitCountTracker,
+            Map<PlanNodeId, DynamicFilter> dynamicFilters,

nodes.bodyText:
Using DynamicFiler for notifications is problematic because we don't know what domains changed specifically (take a look at io.trino.execution.DynamicFiltersCollector#updateDomains of how we send filters from worker to coordinator).
We should have a method like:
DynamicFilterService#registerFragmentDynamicFiltersListener(
  PlanFragment plan,
  Consumer<Map<DynamicFilterId, Domain> newDynamicFilters> listener)

It will also be better testable this way
undo

We should pass filters back to io.trino.sql.planner.LocalDynamicFiltersCollector#collectDynamicFilterDomains.
For that it needs to be part of TaskContext.
The question is what to do with early DFs. DFs sending could be started in io.trino.server.remotetask.HttpRemoteTask.UpdateResponseHandler#success (assuming we have separate service for that).
Does it mean there is just once chance to send DFs? If DFs were not present at HttpRemoteTask creation we would not send them later on?
call it outboundDynamicFilterIds

             OptionalInt totalPartitions,

nodes.bodyText: call it outboundDynamicFilterIds

@@ -35,5 +37,6 @@ RemoteTask createRemoteTask(
             OptionalInt totalPartitions,
             OutputBuffers outputBuffers,
             PartitionedSplitCountTracker partitionedSplitCountTracker,

nodes.bodyText: call it outboundDynamicFilterIds
use ImmutableSet.copyOf

Call it getOutboundDynamicFilters (plus javadoc) or something similar. Current name is too specific and InterStageConsumedDynamic is really a detail.
Also, I already used interStageDynamicFilters within getLazyDynamicFilters
just use taskExecution.getTaskContext().addDynamicFilter(dynamicFilterDomains);

Why do we have to merge local and coordinator dynamic filters?
We can just use existing getLocalDynamicFiltersCollector (we probably don't need io.trino.sql.planner.LocalDynamicFiltersCollector#register anymore)
remove this method, see d2f820c#r660572226

just skip "already collected" check in io.trino.sql.planner.LocalDynamicFiltersCollector#collectDynamicFilterDomains. We already skip it in io.trino.server.DynamicFilterService.DynamicFilterContext#addTaskDynamicFilters
Move io.trino.sql.planner.LocalExecutionPlanner.LocalExecutionPlanContext#dynamicFiltersCollector to TaskContext instead of extra layer of indirection

Make it accept Set<DynamicFilterId> dynamicFilters
domainConsumer -> consumer
callback should be outside of critical section
Why guard on separate object? Just guard on itself
callback should be called outside of critical section
call it outboundDynamicFilterIds
taskDynamicFiltersCollector -> outboundDynamicFiltersCollector
undo
Make it Consumer<Map<DynamicFilterId, Domain>> consumer

We could split dynamicFilterIds into collected and uncollected ones.
Then we could have one callback for all collected ones. This way we would
save on number of callbacks and task update requests when DFs are already collected (e.g when new source stage tasks are added)

similarly you could reduce number of callbacks by constructing
Map<Consumer, Set<DynamicFilterId>> completedConsumers

and then making just one callback per consumer
I don't think you pushed changes
extract this to separate method, e.g needsUpdate() or triggerUpdate()
undo

You don't need any special action here apart:
VersionedDynamicFilterDomains dynamicFilterDomains = taskDynamicFiltersCollector.acknowledgeAndGetNewDomains(sentDynamicFilterVersion);
remove
add a comment what it means
I don't think it synchronizes on right this
you should also acknowledgeAndGetNewDomains to clear pending DFs

note that this callback might be called some time after request is finished, which means that if outbound DF came in the meantime it will resend DFs. I'm not sure we can easily avoid it since it would require to wait for success callback to finish first before scheduling new update.
Maybe we could keep in-flight DFs that would be sent only in case of failure.
use sepatate feature toggle for enabling sending of DFs to workers since it increases communication overhead number_of_worker times.
please extract this change to separate commit

make it more explicit, e.g:
enable_coordinator_dynamic_filters_distribution
Don't we need to check if DF are enabled in general too?
moving localDynamicFiltersCollector to TaskContext should be separate commit
update comment, subContexts is no longer relevant
use getDynamicFiltersCollector
This can't happen because of taskDynamicFilters.remove(filter) == null check before. This section will be executed only once
nit: please add a comment why it cannot be ConcurrentHashMap like the others
undo

simplify:
consumer.accept(
  dynamicFilterIds.stream()
    .collect(toImmutableMap(identity(), filterId -> requireNotNull(dynamicFilterSummaries.get(filterId))))
this cannot really happen since we just collected filter, requireNonNull is sufficient
nit: would be great to add a comment why it needs to be synchronized (so that needsUpdate is not cleared in sendUpdate before actual request is sent)
how does this relate to code below? It has nothing to do with waiting
this will fail if there are 2 table scans (e.g colocated joins) that consume same DF (io.trino.sql.planner.LocalDynamicFiltersCollector#register prevents duplicate registration)
nit: would it be possible to add test to TestHttpRemoteTask?

nodes.bodyText: why it's removed?
why it's removed?
we can expect expectedTableScanDynamicFilter for broadcast join too
add a comment why it isn't racy (normally DF might be collected after page source is created)
this should be separate commit
make it explicit call createPlan(filterId1, filterId1)
why limit bump?

are outbound DFs same as inbound DFs? Would it be possible to use different DFs for outbound DFs?
In fact, please try to add separate unit test (I don't think it will be that verbose)
selective is not exactly the same as empty. I think we should keep the test
keep the test since selective is not exactly same as empty
could you also assert on testingTaskResource.getCreateOrUpdateCounter()?
could you create remoteTask after DF is collected. This can happen when we add nodes and TS tasks are scheduled on them
add a comment, e.g: wait for splits to be received by remote task

commit.message:
Ensure semijoins dynamic filtering is covered by tests

Explicitly disable optimizer.rewrite-filtering-semi-join-to-inner-join
in dynamic filtering tests to ensure that the semi-join related
tests actually test the code path of semi-join dynamic filtering.
Send dynamic filters from coordinator to workers

afterCommit.message: Send dynamic filters from coordinator to workers
